snippet: Though President François Hollande of France has the support of African nations in the region, his army’s fight to preserve a country divided leaves many saying he has overreached.
abstract: New analysis; though France's Pres Francois Hollande has support of African nations in the region, French military's intervention in Mali leaves many observers saying he has overreached.

byline.contributor: John F. Burns contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Though President François Hollande of France has the support of African nations in the region, his army’s fight to preserve a country divided leaves many saying he has overreached.

headline.seo: Hollande’s Intervention in Mali Raises Concerns
headline.main: Stakes for France Are High as Hollande Continues an Intervention in Mali
headline.print_headline: Stakes for France Are High as Hollande Continues an Intervention in Mali
